title: The Final Season of Netflix’s Sex Education Sends Off a Beloved Cast In Style
description: Sex Education's costume designer on how the characters' style informs their endings.

title: How the U.N. Plans to Shape the Future of AI
description: The U.N.'s Secretary General and tech envoy support the idea of a U.N. agency to help the world cooperate in managing AI.

title: Angus Cloud Died of An Accidental Drug Overdose, Coroner Says
description: The 'Euphoria' star died on July 31 at his parents' home in Oakland, Calif.

title: Tropical Storm Warning Issued for U.S. East Coast Ahead of Potential Cyclone
description: The tropical storm warning is in effect from Cape Fear, North Carolina, to Fenwick Island, Delaware.

title: Jail Where Pennsylvania Murderer Escaped Plans to Wall Off Yard
description: The Chester County jail board unanimously approved plans Wednesday to fully enclose the exercise yards.

title: How Wastewater Testing Can Help Tackle America’s Opioid Crisis
description: A wastewater surveillance company is expanding its program to track opioids in sewage.

title: Why We Can’t Get Over the Roman Empire
description: A historian on how Roman Empire offers a distorted view of America.

title: Why India’s Women’s Reservation Bill Is a Major Step Forward
description: A new bill passed in Lok Sabha would reserve one-third of parliament's seats for women, a major boost for gender equality.

title: U.K. Leader Rishi Sunak Waters Down Climate Goals in a Contentious Move
description: Rishi Sunak said he’s delaying a ban on new gas and diesel cars by five years, watering down climate goals.

title: The U.S. Is Allowing Hundreds of Thousands  of Venezuelans in the Country to Work Legally
description: The move may appease Democratic leaders who have pressured the White House to do more to aid asylum seekers.

title: Rupert Murdoch to Step Down as Head of Fox and News Corp.
description: Rupert Murdoch is stepping down at Fox and News Corp. His son Lachlan will take over as chairman.

title: These Latino Leaders Are Reshaping Their Industries–and the Country
description: TIME is featuring prominent U.S.-based Latino leaders across industries who are making an impact from Hollywood to Washington and in between.

title: With Demand for Mental-Health Care Soaring on Campus, Faculty and Students Are Stepping Up to Help
description: Faculty, staff, and even students are now helping to support well-being on college campuses.

title: Author R.F. Kuang on How Fiction Helps Us Think Outside Our Lived Experiences
description: The author's novel 'Yellowface' tackles challenging questions about cultural appropriation, racism in publishing, and social media justice.

title: How Mormonism Went Mainstream
description: Benjamin E. Park explores what the rise of Mormonism reveals about America.

title: Our Vocabulary Is Adapting to a Hotter Planet
description: As the hottest summer ever comes to a close, we're using a slew of terms to describe the phenomenon that is causing all of the suffering.

title: India Suspends Visa Services in Canada as Tensions Grow Over Killing of Sikh Leader
description: A rift widened between the countries after Canada’s leader said India may have been involved in the killing of a Canadian citizen.

title: Syria’s Bashar Al-Assad to Meet With Xi Jinping on First China Visit in Nearly 20 Years
description: Beijing is taking more steps to expand its influence in the Middle East.

title: Thailand to Restrict Cannabis Use, New Prime Minister Says, After Decriminalization Last Year
description: “The law will need to be rewritten,” said Srettha Thavisin, whose Pheu Thai Party promoted a hard-line anti-drug campaign ahead of the May election. “It needs to be rectified.”

title: Ukraine-Poland Friendship Shows Signs of Fraying Over Grain Dispute, Arms Supply
description: A further worsening could have direct implications for the war, as Poland is the primary destination for refugees and the gateway to about 90% of all the western aid and military equipment headed for Kyiv.
